messages.message:
Hey team, recently I’ve seen a lot of customers with use cases requiring split classification (mainly in banking areas this seems to be very common). While it is always a big differentiator over competition, I find it to be one of the most temperamental features on the platform, so much so that I try to caveat the feature with a warning during demos/POCs. In the ANZ POC we’ve been running, it’s the only part of the 5 stage solution we have had to use DL for (there are only 4 classes but LLMs were performing poorly).

Do we have a strategy/plans to improve this feature in AI Hub? Given that Commercial customers don’t have access to advanced apps it feels like we would need to do this well out the box

Hi Hamish, could you provide some more detail on the 4 classes and how LLMs were performing poorly?
There is some ongoing modeldev experimentation on 1) trying split classification with GPT4 vision, 2) making better use of the descriptions provided per class for splitting.

I agree with your general assessment, splitting is an important and valued feature in AI Hub. Cheers <!subteam^S06395ZEFSL>
FYI cannot comment on any plans to potentially make this available to Commercial customers. Maybe @Kaustubh (KD)?
Tentatively, I would assume that all these improvements to split-classification and classification should not be gate kept. I also agree here with your assessment.
The use case here was Financial statements. We wanted to split the document into 4 classes: Balance sheet, Associated Notes (related to BS), Profit and Loss statement, and “other” pages
Not sure I can share many samples but this is a very common doc type, so can find something if required!
If you can help find those it would be super helpful. We would really benefit from having examples and ground truths on anything you can send our way!
This is a sample doc I can share. I can't share the others, but they should be easy enough to find online or from the SE team
I can show or walk you through the ones we have, but could only test on them in our POV sandbox env (which I could add someone to if required)!
in that sample what classes are you looking to split into?
Balance Sheet, P&L, Associated Notes, Other
